definition: same tone/in agreement with/homology (invariant of a topological space in math.)
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
cohomology (invariant of a topological space in math.)

sentences.english: You suddenly notice how in-step you are with the big trends.
sentences.chinese: 你突然注意到你是大流同调的。

sentences.english: Singing on a broad range of men and women with cohomology cavity, cavity with male falsetto.
sentences.chinese: 唱法上音域宽广，男女同腔同调，男腔用假声。

sentences.english: In this paper, an equivalent description of the relative homology is given.
sentences.chinese: 给出群关于其子群的相对同调的一个等价刻划。

sentences.english: Opto-electronic processors, incoherent image processing systems.
sentences.chinese: 光电处理器，非同调影像处理系统。

sentences.english: Each electron would continue precessing as long as its superposition remained coherent.
sentences.chinese: 只要电子处于同调叠加态，就会持续进动。

sentences.english: A heart in tune with God can't help but sing His praise.
sentences.chinese: 人心若与上帝同调，怎能不高唱赞美歌？

sentences.english: The structure of R with small homological dimension is discussed.
sentences.chinese: 讨论论了R在小同调维数时的结构。

sentences.english: The language is purposefully kept on an elementary level, avoiding sheaf theory and cohomology theory.
sentences.chinese: 该语言是有意不断初级程度，避免层论的上同调理论。

definition: harmonious/to adjust/to tune (e.g. wireless receiver)/to bring into harmony
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
